questions.prompt: 1. In BG 9.1, what kind of knowledge does Krishna say He will now impart to Arjuna?
choices: Confidential knowledge of the most secret nature
questions.feedback: Krishna reveals the most confidential and secret knowledge about His supreme position.

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 9.2, what is described as the royal knowledge and royal secret?
choices: Knowledge of Krishna's supreme position and loving devotion to Him
questions.feedback: The supreme knowledge is understanding Krishna as the Absolute Truth and cultivating love for Him.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 9.3, what is the benefit of this knowledge?
choices: It is readily available to all
It is easy to perform and frees one from the bonds of karma
questions.feedback: This knowledge is easy to practice and delivers one from all sinful reactions.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 9.4-5, what does Krishna control through His energies?
choices: All the material elements and all living beings in the material world
questions.feedback: Krishna pervades and sustains the entire material and spiritual creation through His energies.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 9.6, what happens to entities after creating the material world?
choices: They enter into it, and at the end, all enters back into Krishna
questions.feedback: All beings emanate from Krishna and return to Him; He is the source and sustaining principle.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 9.7, what does Krishna do with the material manifestation according to this verse?
choices: He supervises the cosmic manifestation again and again; it is the cycle of creation
questions.feedback: Krishna superintends the cosmic manifestation cyclically; creation and destruction occur under His direction.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 9.8, what is Krishna's relationship to the material nature?
choices: He is superior; material nature works under His direction
questions.feedback: Krishna is not subject to material nature; rather, it acts under His direction.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 9.10, what does Krishna say He does through the energy of nature?
choices: He impregnates material nature and all beings are born
questions.feedback: Krishna impregnates material nature, and all beings are born through the interaction of His energies.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 9.13, what is the nature of those who have achieved God realization?
choices: They are enlightened, they know Krishna to be the only Supreme Personality
questions.feedback: The truly wise see Krishna as the Absolute Truth and the supreme cause of all causes.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 9.14, what are those who are always engaged in Krishna's service compared to?
choices: Devoted yogis who engage in worshiping Krishna in all respects
questions.feedback: Those constantly engaged in Krishna's service are steady-minded and beloved devotees.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 9.15, what is the result for those who perform sacrifices and study scriptures with full engagement in Krishna consciousness?
questions.feedback: Those who engage in worship and study for Krishna's sake attain His abode.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 9.16, what does Krishna say He provides to His devotees?
choices: All provisions and protection; I am the sustaining supporter
questions.feedback: Krishna sustains all creatures and provides for His devotees; He is their ultimate provider.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 9.17, what are Krishna's relationships to creation?
choices: The father, the mother, the sustainer, and the grandfather of all beings
questions.feedback: Krishna is the father, mother, sustainer, and grandfather of all cosmic manifestations.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 9.18, what are the three processes through which Krishna's love flows to His devotees?
questions.feedback: Krishna is the goal, the way, and the sustainer; He is all-knowing, infinite, and all-powerful.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 9.20, what do performers of ritual sacrifices who study the Vedas and drink soma juice desire?
choices: Entry into the heavenly planets; but after that they return to the material world
questions.feedback: Though reaching heavenly planets through fruitive work, they eventually return to the material world.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 9.22, what does Krishna assure His devotees about in terms of provision and protection?
choices: He carries what they lack and preserves what they have
questions.feedback: Krishna ensures His devotees have all necessities and protects what they possess.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 9.24, what are the results for those who worship demigods instead of Krishna?
choices: They reach demigods' planets but must return to the material world
questions.feedback: Worship of demigods yields temporary results in their realms; only Krishna worship is eternal.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 9.25, what is the destination of those devoted to Krishna?
choices: The spiritual world where Krishna resides eternally
questions.feedback: Those devoted to Krishna attain His transcendental abode and never return to the material world.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 9.26, what should one offer to Krishna for His acceptance?
choices: A leaf, flower, fruit, or water with devotion
questions.feedback: Krishna accepts any humble offering given with love and devotion.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 9.27, what should be done with all activities?
choices: Dedicated to Krishna; all actions performed should be for His sake
questions.feedback: All activities should be performed for Krishna and dedicated to Him.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 9.28, what is the result of dedicating all actions to Krishna?
choices: One becomes free from karma and attains liberation
questions.feedback: Dedicating all actions to Krishna frees one from karmic bondage and the cycle of birth and death.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 9.29, how does Krishna treat all beings equally?
choices: Impartially; everyone is equal to Him, yet those who take shelter are His friends
questions.feedback: Krishna is impartial and equal to all, but those who dedicate themselves to Him are especially dear.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 9.30, what is promised even to those who have committed serious sins?
choices: If they are devoted to Krishna with full engagement, they can quickly attain liberation
questions.feedback: Even those with a sinful past can be redeemed through sincere devotion to Krishna.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 9.32, who can achieve the supreme destination according to Krishna?
choices: Women, laborers, merchants, and anyone; they can achieve Krishna's abode
questions.feedback: All classes, genders, and backgrounds can achieve Krishna's abode through devotion.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 9 (summary), what is the main message of Chapter 9?
choices: Krishna is the Absolute Truth and devotion to Him is the supreme path to liberation
questions.feedback: Chapter 9's essence is that Krishna is supreme and loving devotion to Him leads to eternal salvation.
